text: they've been around since 1983
but they won't be round for much longer
this year all of the UK's old pound
coins will be phased out and replaced by
these shiny dodecagon with a gold
colored outer ring and the silver
colored inner ring both thinner and
lighter than the outgoing model
factories has been around for over 30
years at service country really well but
the counterfeiters have caught up with
it so it's fine to introduce something
new for the 21st century and that's what
we're doing with the new 1 pound coin
more than a billion of the 12 sided
coins will flood into circulation on
March the 28th boasting new security
features including a hologram that
changes from a pound symbol to the
number one when seen from different
angles but that's not all joining them
in your purses and pockets will be dream
new designs for the 2 pound and 50 pence
piece we will be commemorating Jane
Austen is great British writer Isaac
Newton great British scientist will also
be issuing a coin in connection with the
centenary of the First World War and be
commemorating the beginnings of the
Royal Air Force a Royal Flying Corps in
the meantime the government has urged

quickly
the famous quid loses its legal tender

John ironmonger BBC news
